It is therefore important for you to protect against unauthorized access to your password, to emails which we may send you, and to your computer or other device. You take full responsibility for maintaining the confidentiality of your password. Furthermore, while we have implemented safeguards, you should be aware that Internet security technology rapidly changes. We cannot guarantee that the safeguards we employ today can protect your personal information from the threats of tomorrow. You should also be aware that despite our efforts, factors beyond our control may result in disclosure of your personal information. Accordingly, we are not in a position to guarantee that your information will be secure under all circumstances.

6. A NOTE ABOUT INTERNATIONAL USERS

We collect, process and maintain your personal information in the United States, where privacy laws may not be as protective as in your home country. If you are using the Services from outside of the United States, by providing your personal information to us you are consenting to the transfer of your personal information to the United States for processing and maintaining in a manner consistent with this Privacy Policy.

7. A SPECIAL NOTE ABOUT THE PRIVACY OF MINORS

Minors (those under 18) are not eligible to use the Services, and we ask that minors not submit any personal information to us or use the Services. We will not knowingly collect information from minors or allow minors to become members of our Services. If we later learn that a minor is a member, then that minor's account will be terminated. With regards to the Intelius and US Search Services, we do not knowingly publish information concerning anyone under the age of 13. If you know of information appearing in these Services concerning anyone under the age of 13, please send an email to us at privacy@peopleconnect.us.

8. NOTICE OF CALIFORNIA PRIVACY RIGHTS

If you are a natural person who is a California resident, you have certain rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act of 2018 (the “CCPA”). These rights include the following:

a. Right to Know About Personal Information Collected, Used, Disclosed or Sold

Under the CCPA, you have the right to request that we disclose to you what personal information we collect, use, disclose or sell. If you are one of our customers, we collect and use the personal information that you provide to us as described in Section 1 of this Privacy Policy. In addition, Section 2 of this Privacy Policy explains when this personal information is disclosed to third parties. You can access the personal information we have collected directly from you by visiting the applicable Website where you are registered or have made a purchase, logging onto the “Account” or similar section of that Website with your user name and password, and viewing this personal information.

The personal information that is available in the reports for sale on Intelius, US Search and our other similar people search Websites is collected from various publicly-available sources, such as government records, phone and other directories, professional licensing and trade organization data, marketing lists, press releases, newspaper articles, and content from blogs and social media websites. The categories of personal information that we collect about you from these sources include the following, if available:

  • Name: first name or initial, middle name or initial, last name, maiden name and aliases
  • Location Information: current and prior street/postal addresses
  • Contact Information: current and prior email addresses and phone numbers
  • Age: current age and date of birth
  • Professional or Employment-Related Information: companies or organizations worked for and positions held
  • Education Information: schools attended and degrees received
  • Social Media: information you have made public on social media websites, which may include some or all of the information above, as well as photos

Please keep in mind that while the list above includes all of the potential types of personal information we may have collected about you, in any given instance we may have collected only a portion of such information.

The personal information in the categories outlined above is processed through our proprietary technology platform to identify common connections and create profiles on individuals that contain this connected information. Certain selected personal information, such as name, age, phone numbers, locations (at a city level), employers and schools attended, is made available to Internet search engine websites for purposes of delivering relevant search results for individuals conducting searches on those websites. Similarly, this same information is used to deliver relevant search results on our Services, as well as websites operated by companies advertising our products and services through their use of our proprietary application programming interfaces (APIs).

Profiles containing all the personal information described above are sold on our Services in the form of phone, address, people search and background check reports. These reports are most often purchased by individual consumers like you for their personal use. However, reports may also be purchased by people working for certain organizations to be used for their business purposes, such as attempting to collect a debt, locating a witness to a crime, or finding missing persons or owners of unclaimed funds, among other reasons. All of our customers are precluded from reselling, republishing or distributing the information contained in our reports and from using such information to determine an individual’s eligibility for credit, insurance, employment, housing or any other purpose prohibited under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. We do not knowingly collect, use or sell any personal information relating to individuals under the age of 18.

If you are a California resident, you can access the personal information we have collected as described above by submitting a verifiable consumer request here. You will be required to provide us with some portions of the personal information described above so that we can verify your identity and match the provided information to the applicable profile in our platform before we provide you with this access.

b. Right to Request Deletion of Personal Information

Under the CCPA, you have the right to request that we delete any personal information we have collected directly from you. This right does not apply to any personal information that we have collected about you from third-party sources as described above. You can delete select portions of the personal information we have collected from you by visiting the applicable Website where you are registered or have made a purchase, logging onto the “Account” or similar section of that Website with your user name and password, accessing your personal information, and deleting the portions of personal information that you want. However, certain minimal personal information is required in order to maintain your account and so cannot be deleted in this way. You also have the option to delete all of your personal information by terminating your account on the applicable Website, which you can do by contacting Customer Support through that Website. Please keep in mind that, even upon the termination of your account, we will continue to retain your personal information for a reasonable period of time in order to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes and enforce our agreements.

c. Right to Opt-Out of the Sale of Personal Information

Under the CCPA, you have the right to opt-out of the sale of your personal information. We do not and will not sell any personal information (as defined in the CCPA) that we collect directly from you. In regards to the personal information that is collected from various publicly-available sources and made available in the reports for sale on Intelius, US Search and our other similar people search Websites, as described above, we provide two methods to California residents to exercise their right to opt-out:

  • Complete our online opt-out process found here. We recommend this method, as it is a simple, automated process that ensures the quickest response to your opt-out request.
  • Send an email to priorityoptout@intelius.com that includes the URL (web address) of the profile found on our Services containing your personal information. You can locate this URL by conducting a search for yourself here. Once you locate the relevant profile in the search results, click on it and cut and paste the URL listed in your web browser into the email. Please keep in mind that this method entails manual intervention on our part, so it will take more time to process than the online method described above.

d. Right to Non-Discrimination for the Exercise of a Consumer’s Privacy Rights

Under the CCPA, you have the right to not to receive discriminatory treatment by us for the exercise of the privacy rights conferred by the CCPA. We will not treat you differently from other consumers if you choose to exercise any of the rights specified above.

e. Authorized Agent

If you want to designate an authorized agent to make a request under the CCPA on your behalf, please contact Customer Support through the applicable Website to get more information about how to do so.

f. Contact for More Information

If you have an questions or concerns about our privacy policies and practices, please send them to us via email at privacy@peopleconnect.us.

9. CHANGES TO OUR PRIVACY POLICY

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time as our information practices are modified or changed. If we make any material changes to this Privacy Policy, we will notify you here, by email (sent to the primary email address specified in your account), or by means of a notice on the Websites. We encourage you to periodically review this page for the latest information on our privacy practices.

If you have questions or complaints regarding this Privacy Policy or our privacy practices, please contact us at: PeopleConnect, Inc., Attention: Policy Compliance, 1501 4th Avenue, Suite 400, Seattle, WA 98101, or email us at . privacy@peopleconnect.us.

You may opt out of targeted advertising by clicking the following links:

  • NIA
  • DAA
  • EVIDON

To remove your information from our database and reports (also known as "opting-out") please send us a request via the online form or email: Opt-Out. Opt-out requests must be submitted to us individually for a particular record. Bulk Opt-out requests will not be fulfilled. Your information will be removed from our database within 15 days.

If you have any problems with your Opt-out request, please request assistance from Customer Care.
